Projects

I know, they're awesome

Android

Asobouyo! GitLab
Role: Developer

My first Android application, あそぼうよ！ or Let's Play!, is an Android application for studying Japanese through listening to songs and filling in the missing lyrics. The login was routed through the Twitter Digits API for Android and the YouTube Android Player API was used to display the music videos. User credentials, score information, and song data is stored on a remote SQL server which is queried with PHP scripts on result of REST operations from the client.

Team: Benedicta Baidoo

Tag! You're It! Webpage
Role: Sole Developer

Tag! You're it! is an Android application that allows users to play tag, but without any of that coming in contact with other humans nonsense. Players are alerted if others in the same game are nearby. Players then proceed to either avoid being tagged or chase their target. The distance between players is reported to the user but not the direction they are, which keeps the players on their toes.
Join Alpha now!

Project: R GitLab
Role: Developer

An Android application I developed with a team using a combination of Java and C++ through the Native Development Kit, it is a 2D top-down, endless running platformer where the user looks down at the player and leads their character through a never ending dungeon.
Get it on the app store now!

Team: Patrick Arbasak, Trevor Berninger

Earthquake Hazards GitHub
Role: Sole Developer

A simple Android application that shows recent Earthquakes from around the world, including information such as coordinates, magnitude, and time, as well as filters to narrow down search results.

Intermediary GitHub
Role: Sole Developer

A mobile application for those who have trouble speaking their own or other languages. Choose any supported locale on Android to say any text you input. Only installed languages are supported. Default language is Japanese due to original concept originating from the need to hear the pronunciation of Chinese characters.

Unacceptable GitHub
Role: Sole Developer

Convey your frustration with the unacceptable things in life with the popular Earl of Lemongrab from Adventure Time as your spokesperson.
Get it on the app store now!

Java

Java Function Tester GitHub
Role: Developer

The Java Function tester was an application created for a High School teacher to help with grading several java classes at once. It reads the output of the functions and compares it against the expected output. If the output is equal to the expected output, that function gets a 'pass.' Otherwise, that function fails and can be reviewed manually.

Team: Justin Fern, Kyle Huntsman

Perspective Rectifier GitHub
Role: Developer

A Java application that uses linear algebra to change the perspective of an image. The user interface was developed in JavaFX Scene Builder 2.

Team: Kyle Huntsman, Brandon Olson

Pokéclient GitHub: Old GitHub
Role: Front-End Developer

Pokéclient is a game master/manager program for Pokémon Tabletop United. Pokémon Tabletop United, or PTU for short, is a tabletop RPG system designed for running games in the world of Pokémon. Production began with the intent to release the application with a JavaFX user interface, but the project is now being rehauled with a web-based frontend using the Bootstrap framework and a Java backend.

Team: Justin Fern, Kyle Huntsman, Brandon Olson

C++

Appointment Manager GitHub
Role: Sole Developer

This project explored the fundamentals of C++ by avoiding the use of array and string from the standard template library and ctime to create a simple appointment manager that reads and writes from a simple text file in the root directory of the project.

NESPi GitHub
Role: Sole Developer

The Nintendo Entertainment System Pi is a portable Raspberry Pi capable of playing NES games. It runs on ArchLinux due it being lightweight, uses Nestopia to emulate NES games using ROMs, and uses various other hardware for portability. For example, the controller was made using an Arduino Leonardo board programmed in C.

Python

Asteroids GitHub
Role: Sole Developer

My first solo project Asteroids, built in PyGame. Art inspired by Geometry Wars.

Bob & Jay Breakout GitHub
Role: Sole Programmer

Created during Tech Jam 2014, the setting of Bob & Jay involves our protagonists breaking out of prison after a convenient earthquake sets them free from their cell. The theme for this Jam was 'connections', so as a result Bob and Jay are chained together by the ankles and cannot move far from one another.

Team: Eric Dutton, Christian Martinez, Austin Ronquillo

Frederick's Quest for Facial Hair GitHub
Role: Developer

Frederick seeks different styles of facial hair, which each give him different and mysterious powers. Developed during the Fall Game Jam of 2014.

Team: Kyle Huntsman, Austin Ronquillo

Web

CloudPad Webpage
Role: Sole Developer

The ultimate combination of collaboration and compilation, CloudPad is a web application that allows users to peer program with one another in a multitude of languages. PeerJS is used to set up a pure client-to-client connection for imitating changes on each screen. AJAX requests send the code users have written to the backend to be received by PHP which proceeds to pass the code as an argument to Bash scripts in order to create, compile, run, and return the result of the code back to the frontend.

Reline.github.io GitHub
Role: Sole Developer

This website! I used the Bootstrap framework for styling, jQuery library for dynamicity (yes, that's a word), and gulpjs for building and uglifying my code. Here are two bonus scripts that I wrote to retrieve a user's GitHub and GitLab feed using jQuery.

Website created by Nathan Reline
